description:
See the possibilities in this solid, older style, brick veneer family home located in beautiful and sought-after old Ocean Grove. Perfectly liveable as is, there is considerable scope for improvement and ample opportunity to stamp your personality throughout. On a sizable block of 840 sqm approx. (development opportunities S.T.C.A) and fully fenced to ensure security and privacy from the street, this property is an ideal family home or coastal holiday home, with short- or long-term rental potential, especially given the self-contained bungalow with ensuite and kitchenette in the rear yard.

Comprising four bedrooms - three in one area of the house and a fourth with ensuite as a later addition, but all with BIRs - the property boasts family friendly features throughout. These include: a recently updated main bathroom with walk-in shower and separate bath accessible from both the master bedroom and the hall; a large, tiled family meals area with a lovely garden outlook capable of withstanding all kinds of mess; and a generous L-shaped lounge area that could incorporate formal dining or perhaps a home office. The functional kitchen includes a servery, built in pantry, new dishwasher and electric cooking, and the laundry includes a large linen press and access to the rear yard.

Other features include undercover parking in the double carport; skylights in select areas of the home that bring in natural light; gas fireplace and reverse cycle air conditioning in the lounge; feature timber walls and ceilings, bay windows and stained-glass windows. The property also has lovely gardens with large lawns in the front and rear yards and established native trees that encourage the local birdlife to visit.

- Great potential to improve or build upon a solid foundation
- Close to the beach, shops, schools and childcare facilities
- Excellent location in sought-after old Ocean Grove
- Secure, fully fenced child- and dog-friendly yard
- Self-contained bungalow with short-term rental potential
- Productive nectarine, apricot and lemon trees
